Description: Lower part of a green basalt kneeling naophorous statue of the great steward Peftuaneith; Osiris within the shrine; three columns of incised Hieroglyphic text on the back-pillar; six columns at the front of the shrine that include the cartouches of Apries; two rows round the plinth; head and upper body lost.
Curator's comments: Published: PM IV, p.63 Piehl, ZAS 31 (1893): 88-9. Heise, OBO 226, 225-8 Cf. Leahy, GM 70 (1984): 50
Condition: incomplete - head and upper body lost
